title: How to Clear Your Cache on Instagram

steps.title: Open your iPhone and find the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone and find the Instagram app. This will look like a camera with a purple-pink background.

steps.title: Hold down on the Instagram app icon.
steps.content: Hold down on the Instagram app icon. Don't click; you don't want to launch the app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Delete App.
steps.content: Click Delete App . This will be in red next to a trashcan icon. [2] X Research source You will be signed out of Instagram. Make sure you know your login credentials before proceeding.

steps.title: Confirm by clicking Delete App again.
steps.content: Confirm by clicking Delete App again. You'll also have the option to Remove from Home Screen , but you'll need to delete it entirely for this to work. [3] X Research source This may take a few seconds.

steps.title: Open the App Store.
steps.content: Open the App Store. This will look like an A with a blue background. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Input "Instagram" in the search bar.
steps.content: Input "Instagram" in the search bar. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Download Instagram.
steps.content: Download Instagram. This may take up to a few minutes depending on your Wi-Fi or cellular connection.

steps.title: Launch Instagram.
steps.content: Launch Instagram. You'll be prompted to Create new account or Log into existing account . Select Log into existing account .

steps.title: Login with your credentials.
steps.content: Login with your credentials. Your cache will be cleared. If needed, you can reset your Instagram password .

steps.title: Open your Android device and navigate to Settings.
steps.content: Open your Android device and navigate to Settings. This will have a cog icon. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Apps & notifications.
steps.content: Click Apps & notifications . Some devices may have different names, but you'll need to use your application manager. This is also the place you can restart apps or delete apps on Android .

steps.title: Click App info.
steps.content: Click App info . This will also show you the number of apps you currently have installed.

steps.title: Scroll down and click "Instagram".
steps.content: Scroll down and click "Instagram". This will have a camera icon with a purple-pink background. Make sure you know your Instagram login credentials before clearing your cache. You may be signed out during this process.

steps.title: Click Storage & cache.
steps.content: Click Storage & cache . You'll be able to see the amount of data and cache stored on your device.

steps.title: Click Clear cache.
steps.content: Click Clear cache . This will be underneath a trashcan icon. [7] X Research source When the cache is cleared, you will see 0 bytes near the data information.

steps.title: Launch Instagram.
steps.content: Launch Instagram. You'll be prompted to Create new account or Log into existing account . Select Log into existing account .

steps.title: Login with your credentials.
steps.content: Login with your credentials. Your cache will be cleared.

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app.

steps.title: On the home screen, tap the profile icon.
steps.content: On the home screen, tap the profile icon. This will be located on the bottom right, indicated by your profile picture. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰ on the top right.
steps.content: Tap ☰ on the top right. A window will pop up with more options. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Your activity.
steps.content: Click Your activity . This will display all your activity in one place. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Click Recent searches.
steps.content: Click Recent searches . It will be next to a magnifying glass. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear all in the top right corner.
steps.content: Click Clear all in the top right corner. You'll be able to find all your recent searches here. [12] X Research source You'll be prompted to confirm your action. Click Clear all again. If you don't want to clear your history, click Not now .
